trans-unit.source: Calculations for Production Structures

seg-source.mrk: Calculations for Production Structures

trans-unit.source: Calculations can be made for any type of Production Structure. The process of creating the calculation is the same for each; the difference lies in the required information due to item definitions during product development.

seg-source.mrk: Calculations can be made for any type of Production Structure.
The process of creating the calculation is the same for each; the difference lies in the required information due to item definitions during product development.

trans-unit.source: When creating a Development Structure, often the output item and some components have not been defined (in the idea of conceptual item without an Item Card). Therefore, special RnD fields in the header and lines must be populated to provide the necessary conversion of weights, unit of measure and costing information for calculating recipes.

seg-source.mrk: When creating a Development Structure, often the output item and some components have not been defined (in the idea of conceptual item without an Item Card).
Therefore, special RnD fields in the header and lines must be populated to provide the necessary conversion of weights, unit of measure and costing information for calculating recipes.

trans-unit.source: For Laboratory Structures, all components must be defined with actual items, but the output item may not be defined yet. Therefore, the special RnD fields in the header must be populated to provide the necessary conversion of net and recipe weights for calculating recipes.

seg-source.mrk: For Laboratory Structures, all components must be defined with actual items, but the output item may not be defined yet.
Therefore, the special RnD fields in the header must be populated to provide the necessary conversion of net and recipe weights for calculating recipes.

trans-unit.source: Items are completely defined in a Manufacturing Structure before it can be certified and, thus, a Calculation created. Therefore, no special fields are necessary for calculating recipes; the weights and costs from the Item Cards of the product (output) are used.

seg-source.mrk: Items are completely defined in a Manufacturing Structure before it can be certified and, thus, a Calculation created.
Therefore, no special fields are necessary for calculating recipes; the weights and costs from the Item Cards of the product (output) are used.

trans-unit.source: Another difference to the previously described Production Structures, is that the values in the special RnD fields, as well as the actual Calculations, are not transferred from Development Structure to Laboratory Structure, and Laboratory Structure to Manufacturing Structure. Each Calculation is specific to each particular Production Structure.

seg-source.mrk: Another difference to the previously described Production Structures, is that the values in the special RnD fields, as well as the actual Calculations, are not transferred from Development Structure to Laboratory Structure, and Laboratory Structure to Manufacturing Structure.
Each Calculation is specific to each particular Production Structure.

trans-unit.source: This topic first describes the basic Calculation creation process on a Manufacturing Structure, since additional information is not required to create the Calculation. Then the special fields in the Development and Laboratory Structures are described.

seg-source.mrk: This topic first describes the basic Calculation creation process on a Manufacturing Structure, since additional information is not required to create the Calculation.
Then the special fields in the Development and Laboratory Structures are described.

trans-unit.source: Calculations for Manufacturing Structures

seg-source.mrk: Calculations for Manufacturing Structures

trans-unit.source: In the Production Structure, click Calculation on the ribbon.

seg-source.mrk: In the Production Structure, click Calculation on the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: : Creating the Calculation on a Production Structure

seg-source.mrk: : Creating the Calculation on a Production Structure

trans-unit.source: If no calculation is available for the production structure, no calculations appear in the Calculation List page. Click New to create a new calculation and then press ENTER or TAB to assign a number.

seg-source.mrk: If no calculation is available for the production structure, no calculations appear in the Calculation List page.
Click New to create a new calculation and then press ENTER or TAB to assign a number.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to create more than one calculation for one production structure.

seg-source.mrk: It is possible to create more than one calculation for one production structure.

trans-unit.source: If the Standard Calc. Schedule No. field on the item used in the production structure is filled in, the standard calculation schedule is used for the new calculation. Otherwise the application shows the calculation schedule list and the user must select a calculation schedule manually.

seg-source.mrk: If the <span class="Bold">Standard Calc.
Schedule No.
field on the item used in the production structure is filled in, the standard calculation schedule is used for the new calculation.
Otherwise the application shows the calculation schedule list and the user must select a calculation schedule manually.

trans-unit.source: The values of the production structure are transferred to the calculation header.

seg-source.mrk: The values of the production structure are transferred to the calculation header.

trans-unit.source: The link between the production structure and the calculation is the production structure number.

seg-source.mrk: The link between the production structure and the calculation is the production structure number.

trans-unit.source: : Calculation created for a Production Structure

seg-source.mrk: : Calculation created for a Production Structure

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: The values in the Lines FastTab are calculated by running the “Update Calculation” function.

seg-source.mrk: The values in the Lines FastTab are calculated by running the “Update Calculation” function.

trans-unit.source: Clicking the Value (LCY) field for a calculated entry opens the Calculation Detail Lines, which shows the lines that create the calculated value.

seg-source.mrk: Clicking the Value (LCY) field for a calculated entry opens the Calculation Detail Lines, which shows the lines that create the calculated value.

trans-unit.source: : Calculation Detail Lines for Production Structure Calculation

seg-source.mrk: : Calculation Detail Lines for Production Structure Calculation

trans-unit.source: Calculation Groups in Production Structure Lines

seg-source.mrk: Calculation Groups in Production Structure Lines

trans-unit.source: Item and capacity calculation groups are transferred from the item and work center or machine center via production structure line to the production order routing lines and production order components.

seg-source.mrk: Item and capacity calculation groups are transferred from the item and work center or machine center via production structure line to the production order routing lines and production order components.

trans-unit.source: Since production order calculations use the calculation groups from the production order routing lines and production order components – not directly from the item and work center or machine center – the calculation groups can be changed on the production structure lines.

seg-source.mrk: Since production order calculations use the calculation groups from the production order routing lines and production order components – not directly from the item and work center or machine center – the calculation groups can be changed on the production structure lines.

trans-unit.source: Calculations for Development Structures

seg-source.mrk: Calculations for Development Structures

trans-unit.source: As previously stated, calculations can be made for Development Structures, even if no output item or components have been identified. When the Unit of Measure Code field in the header is populated, the RnD Net Weight and RnD Receipt Weight fields are automatically set to 1 (e.g., 1 Kg of the output item). Setting these fields allows for calculating share quantities, which would not be possible without an item because there would be no weight for quantity calculation.

seg-source.mrk: As previously stated, calculations can be made for Development Structures, even if no output item or components have been identified.
When the Unit of Measure Code field in the header is populated, the RnD Net Weight and RnD Receipt Weight fields are automatically set to 1 (e.g., 1 Kg of the output item).
Setting these fields allows for calculating share quantities, which would not be possible without an item because there would be no weight for quantity calculation.

trans-unit.source: : RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields set to 1 from populated Unit of Measure Code

seg-source.mrk: : RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields set to 1 from populated Unit of Measure Code

trans-unit.source: The RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields provide the same purpose as the Net Weight and Recipe Weight fields on the Item Card (refer to topic “Recipe Weight and Net Weight” on page 1 for more information).

seg-source.mrk: The RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields provide the same purpose as the Net Weight and Recipe Weight fields on the Item Card (refer to topic “Recipe Weight and Net Weight” on page 1 for more information).

trans-unit.source: With the proper weight information in the header, recipes in the Lines FastTab can be calculated. For recipes without an actual item, the Unit of Measure Code, RnD Unit Cost per, and Calculation Group Code fields must be populated because these values typically originate from the Item Card. (RnD Unit Cost per is equivalent to the Unit Cost on the Item Card). Once filled, the Shares/Share % fields must populated to complete the setup for product development.

seg-source.mrk: With the proper weight information in the header, recipes in the Lines FastTab can be calculated.
For recipes without an actual item, the Unit of Measure Code, RnD Unit Cost per, and Calculation Group Code fields must be populated because these values typically originate from the Item Card.
(RnD Unit Cost per is equivalent to the Unit Cost on the Item Card).
Once filled, the Shares/Share % fields must populated to complete the setup for product development.

trans-unit.source: : Dummy item with required fields for calculation

seg-source.mrk: : Dummy item with required fields for calculation

trans-unit.source: After certifying the Development Structure, a calculation can be created using the same process as described in topic <MadCap:xref href="#Calculat" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculations for Manufacturing Structures” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: After certifying the Development Structure, a calculation can be created using the same process as described in topic <MadCap:xref href="#Calculat" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculations for Manufacturing Structures” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: Since no item exists yet, the calculation schedule list opens and the user must select a calculation schedule manually.

seg-source.mrk: Since no item exists yet, the calculation schedule list opens and the user must select a calculation schedule manually.

trans-unit.source: As before, the values of the Development Structure are transferred to the calculation header, and the link between the Development Structure and the calculation is the production structure number.

seg-source.mrk: As before, the values of the Development Structure are transferred to the calculation header, and the link between the Development Structure and the calculation is the production structure number.

trans-unit.source: : New calculation created from Development Structure

seg-source.mrk: : New calculation created from Development Structure

trans-unit.source: If the Calculation Detail Lines are opened from the Value (LCY) field, all components, including the dummy item, appear with proper calculation based on the Net Weight and Recipe Weights from the Development Structure header.

seg-source.mrk: If the Calculation Detail Lines are opened from the Value (LCY) field, all components, including the dummy item, appear with proper calculation based on the Net Weight and Recipe Weights from the Development Structure header.

trans-unit.source: : Calculation Detail Lines from Development Structure Calculation, with dummy item

seg-source.mrk: : Calculation Detail Lines from Development Structure Calculation, with dummy item

trans-unit.source: During the development process, it is possible that the weight changes, e.g., boiling 1 kg of water results in only 800 grams of the output item. Therefore, the weights need to be changed to generate an accurate calculation. In the Development Structure header, changes can be made but note that the RnD Recipe Weight must be higher than the RnD Net Weight.

seg-source.mrk: During the development process, it is possible that the weight changes, e.g., boiling 1 kg of water results in only 800 grams of the output item.
Therefore, the weights need to be changed to generate an accurate calculation.
In the Development Structure header, changes can be made but note that the RnD Recipe Weight must be higher than the RnD Net Weight.

trans-unit.source: : Changed RnD Net Weight field in Development Structure

seg-source.mrk: : Changed RnD Net Weight field in Development Structure

trans-unit.source: Due to the change in the Development Structure, a new calculation should be created. As before, the values of the production structure are transferred to the calculation header.

seg-source.mrk: Due to the change in the Development Structure, a new calculation should be created.
As before, the values of the production structure are transferred to the calculation header.

trans-unit.source: When the “Update Calculation” function is run, the values are recalculated based on the new weight.

seg-source.mrk: When the “Update Calculation” function is run, the values are recalculated based on the new weight.

trans-unit.source: : New calculation based on net weight change in Development Structure

seg-source.mrk: : New calculation based on net weight change in Development Structure

trans-unit.source: As previously stated, if the “Create Laboratory Structure” function is run from the Development Structure, the values in the special fields in the header and the calculation is not transferred.

seg-source.mrk: As previously stated, if the “Create Laboratory Structure” function is run from the Development Structure, the values in the special fields in the header and the calculation is not transferred.

trans-unit.source: Calculations for Laboratory Structures

seg-source.mrk: Calculations for Laboratory Structures

trans-unit.source: A Laboratory Structure cannot be certified with missing items in the Lines FastTab. However, it can be certified without an item in the header. Therefore, the RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields are available in the header for calculation purposes. The same as in the Development Structure, the fields are automatically set to 1 when the Unit of Measure Code field is populated in the header.

seg-source.mrk: A Laboratory Structure cannot be certified with missing items in the Lines FastTab.
However, it can be certified without an item in the header.
Therefore, the RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields are available in the header for calculation purposes.
The same as in the Development Structure, the fields are automatically set to 1 when the Unit of Measure Code field is populated in the header.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: If the “Create Laboratory Structure” function was used, the Unit of Measure Code field must be revalidated to update the RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields.

seg-source.mrk: If the “Create Laboratory Structure” function was used, the Unit of Measure Code field must be revalidated to update the RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields.

trans-unit.source: : RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields set to 1 from populated Unit of Measure Code, valid item added to calculation lines

seg-source.mrk: : RnD Net Weight and RnD Recipe Weight fields set to 1 from populated Unit of Measure Code, valid item added to calculation lines

trans-unit.source: After certifying the Laboratory Structure, a Calculation can be created using the same process as described in topic <MadCap:xref href="#Calculat" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculations for Manufacturing Structures” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: After certifying the Laboratory Structure, a Calculation can be created using the same process as described in topic <MadCap:xref href="#Calculat" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculations for Manufacturing Structures” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: Since no item exists yet, the calculation schedule list opens and the user must select a calculation schedule manually.

seg-source.mrk: Since no item exists yet, the calculation schedule list opens and the user must select a calculation schedule manually.

trans-unit.source: As before, the values of the Laboratory Structure are transferred to the calculation header, and the link between the Laboratory Structure and the calculation is the production structure number.

seg-source.mrk: As before, the values of the Laboratory Structure are transferred to the calculation header, and the link between the Laboratory Structure and the calculation is the production structure number.

trans-unit.source: If the Calculation Detail Lines are opened from the Value (LCY) field, all components appear with proper calculation based on the Net Weight and Recipe Weights from the Laboratory Structure header.

seg-source.mrk: If the Calculation Detail Lines are opened from the Value (LCY) field, all components appear with proper calculation based on the Net Weight and Recipe Weights from the Laboratory Structure header.

trans-unit.source: : Calculation Detail Lines from Laboratory Structure Calculation

seg-source.mrk: : Calculation Detail Lines from Laboratory Structure Calculation

trans-unit.source: Similar to the development process, weight change can occur in the laboratory. Therefore, the weights need to be changed in the Laboratory Structure to generate an accurate calculation. In the header, changes can be made but note that the RnD Recipe Weight must be higher than the RnD Net Weight.

seg-source.mrk: Similar to the development process, weight change can occur in the laboratory.
Therefore, the weights need to be changed in the Laboratory Structure to generate an accurate calculation.
In the header, changes can be made but note that the RnD Recipe Weight must be higher than the RnD Net Weight.

trans-unit.source: Due to the change in the Laboratory Structure, a new calculation should be created. As before, the values of the production structure are transferred to the calculation header.

As before, the values of the production structure are transferred to the calculation header.

trans-unit.source: When the “Update Calculation” function is run, the values are recalculated based on the new weight.

trans-unit.source: As previously stated, if the “Create Manufacturing Structure” function is run from the Laboratory Structure, the values in the special fields in the header and the calculation is not transferred.
